required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability Study of KNS-760704 in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)
clinical_study.official_title: A 2-Part, Randomized, Double-Blind, Safety and Tolerability Study Evaluating KNS-760704 in Patients With Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)

brief_summary.textblock:
This was a 2-part study of dexpramipexole in patients with ALS.
Part 1 was a randomized, placebo-controlled, multi-center study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and clinical effects of oral administration of 3 dosage levels of dexpramipexole vs. placebo for 12 weeks.
Part 2 was a randomized, double-blind, 2-arm, parallel group, extension study evaluating the safety, tolerability, and clinical effects of oral administration of 2 dosage levels of dexpramipexole for up to 72 weeks.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study was a two-part, multicenter, double-blind study in subjects with ALS to evaluate the safety and tolerability of dexpramipexole treatment, as well as the preliminary effects on measures of clinical function and mortality of dexpramipexole treatment.
In part 1, 102 subjects with ALS were randomized at 20 US sites to receive placebo, dexpramipexole at 50 mg/day; dexpramipexole at 150 mg/day; or dexpramipexole at 300 mg/day for 12 weeks. Participants who completed Part 1 were eligible to enroll into Part 2.
Part 2 was a randomized, double-blind, 2-arm, parallel-group, extension study evaluating the longer-term safety, tolerability, and clinical effects of oral administration of 2 dosage levels of dexpramipexole. In part 2, following a 4-week, placebo washout, continuing subjects received dexpramipexole at 50 mg/day or 300 mg/day as double-blind treatment for up to 72 additional weeks (Part 2 duration was up to a total of 76 weeks, including the 4 week placebo portion).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Matching placebo during Part 1 and Part 2 placebo washout.

primary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Hematology Results by Treatment Group
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Potentially Clinically Significant Hematology Results by Treatment Group. Percentages based on number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group. Patients are only counted once per criterion per laboratory test.

primary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Blood Chemistry Results by Treatment Group
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Potentially Clinically Significant Blood Chemistry Results by Treatment Group. Percentages based on number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group. Patients are only counted once per criterion per laboratory test.

primary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Potentially Clinically Significant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Findings by Treatment Group
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Treatment Emergent Potentially Clinically Significant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Findings by Treatment Group. Percentages are based on the number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group.

primary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Vital Sign Measurements by Treatment Group
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Potentially Clinically Significant Vital Sign Measurements by Treatment Group. Percentages are based on the number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Slope of ALSFRS-R (ALS Functional Rating Scale With Respiratory Component) From Baseline to Week 12 by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: The ALSFRS-R (ALS functional rating scale with respiratory component) is a validated scale which measures 4 functional domains, comprising respiratory function, bulbar function, gross motor skills, and fine motor skills. There are a total of 12 questions, each scored from 0 to 4 for a total possible score of 48, with higher scores representing better function. Slope is calculated using a linear mixed effects model with x-axis time in months and y-axis ALSFRS-R score. Units for slope are change per month in units on the ALSFRS-R scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Slope of Upright Vital Capacity From Baseline to Week 12 by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: Slope of change in Upright Vital Capacity (percent predicted upright vital capacity) from Baseline to Week 12. A negative change/slope indicates clinical worsening. Slope is calculated using a linear mixed effects model with x-axis time in months and y-axis as percent predicted upright vital capacity. Units for slope are change per month in percent predicted upright vital capacity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Placebo Washout: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Hematology
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Potentially Clinically Significant Hematology Results by Treatment Group. Percentages based on number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group. Patients are only counted once per criterion per laboratory test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Placebo Washout: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Blood Chemistry Results
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Potentially Clinically Significant Blood Chemistry Results by Treatment Group. Percentages based on number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group. Patients are only counted once per criterion per laboratory test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Placebo Washout: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Potentially Clinically Significant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Findings
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Treatment Emergent Potentially Clinically Significant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Findings by Treatment Group. Percentages are based on the number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Placebo Washout: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Vital Sign Measurements
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Potentially Clinically Significant Vital Sign Measurements by Treatment Group. Percentages are based on the number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Placebo Washout: Absolute Change in ALSFRS-R Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: The ALSFRS-R (ALS functional rating scale with respiratory component) is a validated scale which measures 4 functional domains, comprising respiratory function, bulbar function, gross motor skills, and fine motor skills. There are a total of 12 questions, each scored from 0 to 4 for a total possible score of 48, with higher scores representing better function. Units are points on the ALSFRS-R score as an absolute change from the baseline of the placebo washout to week 4 of the placebo washout.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Placebo Washout: Absolute Change in Upright Vital Capacity (Percent Predicted) From Baseline to End of Placebo Washout (Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Absolute change in Upright Vital Capacity From Baseline to Week 4. Units are percent of predicted Upright Vital Capacity. A negative change indicates clinical worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Double-Blind Treatment: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Hematology Results by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Potentially Clinically Significant Hematology Results by Treatment Group. Percentages based on number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group. Patients are only counted once per criterion per parameter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Double-Blind Treatment: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Blood Chemistry Results by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Potentially Clinically Significant Blood Chemistry Results by Treatment Group. Percentages based on number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group. Patients are only counted once per criterion per parameter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Double-Blind Treatment: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Potentially Clinically Significant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Findings by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Treatment Emergent Potentially Clinically Significant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Findings by Treatment Group. Percentages based on number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group. Patients are only counted once per criterion per parameter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Double-Blind Treatment: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Vital Sign Measurements by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Potentially Clinically Significant Vital Sign Measurements by Treatment Group. Percentages based on number of patients with at least one non-missing post-baseline value in each treatment group. Patients are only counted once per criterion per parameter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Double-Blind Treatment: Slope of the ALSFRS-R (ALS Functional Rating Scale With Respiratory Component) From Baseline to Week 28 by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: The ALSFRS-R (ALS functional rating scale with respiratory component) is a validated scale which measures 4 functional domains, comprising respiratory function, bulbar function, gross motor skills, and fine motor skills. There are a total of 12 questions, each scored from 0 to 4 for a total possible score of 48, with higher scores representing better function. Slope is calculated using a linear mixed effects model with x-axis time in months and y-axis ALSFRS-R score. Units for slope are change per month n units on the ALSFRS-R scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2 Double-Blind Treatment: Slope of Percent Predicted Upright Vital Capacity From Baseline by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of randomized phase of Part 2 to week 28 of randomized phase of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: Slope of Upright Vital Capacity (percent predicted) through Week 28. A negative change indicates clinical worsening. Slope is calculated using a linear mixed effects model with x-axis time in months and y-axis percent predicted upright vital capacity. Units for slope are change per month in percent predicted upright vital capacity.

arm_group.description: During Part 1, subjects received twice daily doses of dexpramipexole (50 mg/day, 150 mg/day, or 300 mg/day) or matching placebo for approximately 12 weeks.
At the beginning of Part 2, subjects received twice daily doses of placebo for approximately 4 weeks.
Following the Part 2 placebo washout, subjects received dexpramipexole (50 mg/day or 300 mg/day), subjects received twice daily doses of placebo for up to 18 months.

intervention.description: Placebo: 2 tablets taken orally twice daily
Dexpramipexole: 2 x 12.5 mg tablets taken orally twice daily
Dexpramipexole: 2 x 37.5 mg tablets taken orally twice daily
Dexpramipexole: 2 x 75 mg tablets taken orally twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with diagnosis of familial or sporadic ALS, defined as meeting the possible, laboratory-supported probable, probable, or definite criteria for a diagnosis of ALS according to the World Federation of Neurology El Escorial criteria
- Patients with ALS symptom onset < 24 months from randomization
- Patients with upright vital capacity (VC) > 65% of predicted for age, height, and gender
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients in whom causes of neuromuscular weakness other than ALS have not been excluded
- Patients without clinical evidence of upper motor neuron dysfunction
- Patients with clinically suspected ALS according to the World Federation of Neurology El Escorial criteria
- Patients with prior exposure to KNS-760704 or the R(+) enantiomer of pramipexole (i.e., R(+)-pramipexole)
- Patients taking other investigational agents (including lithium) within 30 days of randomization or during the study

UCLA, Dept. of Neurology - Neuromuscular/ALS Research Center

results_reference.citation: Cudkowicz M, Bozik ME, Ingersoll EW, Miller R, Mitsumoto H, Shefner J, Moore DH, Schoenfeld D, Mather JL, Archibald D, Sullivan M, Amburgey C, Moritz J, Gribkoff VK. The effects of dexpramipexole (KNS-760704) in individuals with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. Nat Med. 2011 Nov 20;17(12):1652-6. doi: 10.1038/nm.2579.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited for the study across 20 recruiting centers US between 09 April 2008 and 26 January 2009 in medical centers located the USA.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Study conducted in 2 parts: When the first 12 weeks (Part 1) was completed, eligible continuing subjects entered a 4 week placebo washout before being re-randomized to receive either 50 mg/day dexpramipexole or 300 mg/day dexpramipexole for up to 72 additional weeks.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Inability to attend study visits in person

baseline.population: all patients who signed an informed consent and were screened for the study, whether randomized or not

measure.population: Safety Population: Data from all enrolled subjects who were randomized in Part 1, received at least 1 dose of study drug, and had at least one post baseline evaluation.

class.title: Systolic Blood Pressure Increase of > 20 mmHg from baseline and >= 180mmHg
Systolic Blood Pressure Decrease of < -20 mmHg from baseline and <= 90 mmHg
Diastolic Blood Pressure Increase of > 15 mmHg from baseline and >= 105 mmHg
Diastolic Blood Pressure Decrease of < -15 mmHg from baseline and <= 50 mmHg
Pulse Increase of > 15 bpm from baseline and >= 120
Pulse Decrease of < -15 bpm from baseline and <= 50
Body Weight Increase of > 7% lbs from baseline
Body Weight Decrease of < -7% lbs from baseline

outcome.title: Part 2 Double-Blind Treatment: Slope of the ALSFRS-R (ALS Functional Rating Scale With Respiratory Component) From Baseline to Week 28 by Treatment Group
outcome.description: The ALSFRS-R (ALS functional rating scale with respiratory component) is a validated scale which measures 4 functional domains, comprising respiratory function, bulbar function, gross motor skills, and fine motor skills. There are a total of 12 questions, each scored from 0 to 4 for a total possible score of 48, with higher scores representing better function. Slope is calculated using a linear mixed effects model with x-axis time in months and y-axis ALSFRS-R score. Units for slope are change per month n units on the ALSFRS-R scale.
outcome.population: Randomized subjects who had at least 1 post-baseline clinical status evaluation with 7 days of discontinuing study drug

group.title: Dexpramipexole (50 mg/Day)
group.description: Two 12.5 mg tablets taken orally twice daily for 12 weeks

group.title: Dexpramipexole (300 mg/Day)
group.description: Two 75 mg tablets taken orally twice daily for 12 weeks

measure.title: Part 2 Double-Blind Treatment: Slope of the ALSFRS-R (ALS Functional Rating Scale With Respiratory Component) From Baseline to Week 28 by Treatment Group
measure.description: The ALSFRS-R (ALS functional rating scale with respiratory component) is a validated scale which measures 4 functional domains, comprising respiratory function, bulbar function, gross motor skills, and fine motor skills. There are a total of 12 questions, each scored from 0 to 4 for a total possible score of 48, with higher scores representing better function. Slope is calculated using a linear mixed effects model with x-axis time in months and y-axis ALSFRS-R score. Units for slope are change per month n units on the ALSFRS-R scale.
measure.population: Randomized subjects who had at least 1 post-baseline clinical status evaluation with 7 days of discontinuing study drug

analysis.estimate_desc: 50 mg/day minus 150 mg/day arm, negative direction represents worse outcome.

outcome.title: Part 2 Double-Blind Treatment: Slope of Percent Predicted Upright Vital Capacity From Baseline by Treatment Group
outcome.description: Slope of Upright Vital Capacity (percent predicted) through Week 28. A negative change indicates clinical worsening. Slope is calculated using a linear mixed effects model with x-axis time in months and y-axis percent predicted upright vital capacity. Units for slope are change per month in percent predicted upright vital capacity.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline of randomized phase of Part 2 to week 28 of randomized phase of Part 2
outcome.population: Randomized subjects who had at least 1 post-baseline clinical status evaluation with 7 days of discontinuing study drug.

group.title: Dexpramipexole (50 mg/Day)
group.description: Two 12.5 mg tablets taken orally twice daily for 12 weeks

group.title: Dexpramipexole (300 mg/Day)
group.description: Two 75 mg tablets taken orally twice daily for 12 weeks

measure.title: Part 2 Double-Blind Treatment: Slope of Percent Predicted Upright Vital Capacity From Baseline by Treatment Group
measure.description: Slope of Upright Vital Capacity (percent predicted) through Week 28. A negative change indicates clinical worsening. Slope is calculated using a linear mixed effects model with x-axis time in months and y-axis percent predicted upright vital capacity. Units for slope are change per month in percent predicted upright vital capacity.
measure.population: Randomized subjects who had at least 1 post-baseline clinical status evaluation with 7 days of discontinuing study drug.

analysis.estimate_desc: 50 mg/day minus 300 mg/day treatment arm, negative direction represents worse outcome.

reported_events.time_frame: Part 1: up to 12 weeks; Part 2 Placebo washout: up to 4 weeks; Part 2 Treatment period: up to 18 months

group.title: Part 1: Placebo
group.description: Two matching PBO tablets taken orally twice daily for 12 weeks

group.description: Two 12.5 mg tablets taken orally twice daily for 12 weeks

group.title: Part 1: Dexpramipexole (150 mg/Day)
group.description: Two 37.5 mg tablets taken orally twice daily for 12 weeks

group.title: Part 1: Dexpramipexole (300 mg/Day)

group.title: Part 2: Placebo Washout
group.description: Two matching PBO tablets taken orally twice daily for 4 weeks

group.title: Part 2: Dexpramipexole (50 mg/Day)
group.description: Two 12.5 mg tablets taken orally twice daily for up to 18 months

group.title: Part 2: Dexpramipexole (300 mg/Day)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
